docs.title: YunMin Trading Bot
docs.text: Welcome to YunMin, an AI-powered cryptocurrency trading agent with advanced ML and LLM capabilities.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
YunMin is a sophisticated trading bot that combines:

  • 🤖 AI-Powered Decisions: Multiple LLM models (Groq, OpenAI, Grok) provide intelligent trading signals
  • 📊 Machine Learning: LSTM predictors and pattern recognition for market analysis
  • 🛡️ Risk Management: Advanced position sizing, stop-loss, and circuit breakers
  • 📈 Real-time Monitoring: Live dashboard and Grafana integration
  • 🔄 Multiple Strategies: AI V2, AI V3, and rule-based strategies

docs.title: AI & ML
docs.text:
• Multi-model ensemble voting for higher confidence
  • Sentiment analysis and market regime detection
  • Adaptive position sizing based on performance
  • LSTM-based price prediction

docs.title: Risk Management
docs.text:
• Dynamic risk limits and circuit breakers
  • Position sizing optimization (Kelly Criterion)
  • Hedging strategies for downside protection
  • Emergency stop protocols

docs.title: Monitoring & Alerts
docs.text:
• Real-time CLI dashboard with Rich UI
  • Telegram/Email/Desktop notifications
  • Prometheus metrics and Grafana dashboards
  • Comprehensive trade journaling

docs.title: Developer Tools
docs.text:
• Interactive configuration wizard
  • Docker development environment
  • Pre-commit hooks for code quality
  • Comprehensive test suite

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Quickstart Guide - Get started in 15 minutes
  • Configuration - Configure your bot
  • AI Strategies - Learn about AI trading strategies
  • Architecture Overview - System architecture
  • Contributing - Contribute to YunMin

docs.title: TradingEngine
docs.text:
Main orchestrator for live/dry-run trading.

Constructor: 

TradingEngine(
    strategy: BaseStrategy,
    connector: ExchangeConnector,
    risk_manager: RiskManager,
    executor: Executor,
    store: Store,
    config: TradingConfig,
    alert_manager: Optional[AlertManager] = None
)

Methods:

  • start() -> None: Start trading loop
  • stop() -> None: Stop trading gracefully
  • process_signal(signal: Signal) -> None: Process strategy signal
  • get_status() -> Dict[str, Any]: Get current engine status

Example: 

from yunmin.core.trading_engine import TradingEngine
from yunmin.strategy.ema_crossover import EMACrossoverStrategy
from yunmin.connectors.binance_connector import BinanceConnector

engine = TradingEngine(
    strategy=EMACrossoverStrategy(),
    connector=BinanceConnector(),
    risk_manager=RiskManager(),
    executor=Executor(),
    store=SQLiteStore("./data/bot.db"),
    config=TradingConfig(mode="dry_run")
)

engine.start()

docs.title: RiskManager
docs.text:
Validates trades against risk policies.

Constructor: 

RiskManager(
    max_position_pct: float = 0.5,
    max_daily_loss: float = 1000,
    max_open_positions: int = 5
)

Methods:

  • can_open_position(size: float, price: float, balance: float) -> Tuple[bool, str]: Check if position can be opened
  • check_daily_loss(trades: List[Trade]) -> bool: Check daily loss limit
  • calculate_position_size(balance: float, risk_pct: float) -> float: Calculate safe position size

Example: 

from yunmin.risk.manager import RiskManager

risk_mgr = RiskManager(
    max_position_pct=0.3,  # 30% max position
    max_daily_loss=500      # $500 max daily loss
)

can_trade, reason = risk_mgr.can_open_position(
    size=1000,
    price=45000,
    balance=10000
)

if can_trade:
    print("Trade approved")
else:
    print(f"Trade blocked: {reason}")

docs.title: AlertManager
docs.text:
Multi-channel notification system.

Constructor: 

AlertManager(config: AlertConfig)

AlertConfig: 

@dataclass
class AlertConfig:
    telegram_enabled: bool = False
    telegram_bot_token: str = ""
    telegram_chat_id: str = ""

    email_enabled: bool = False
    email_from: str = ""
    email_to: str = ""
    smtp_host: str = "smtp.gmail.com"
    smtp_port: int = 587
    smtp_user: str = ""
    smtp_password: str = ""

    webhook_enabled: bool = False
    webhook_url: str = ""

    log_enabled: bool = True
    rate_limit_seconds: int = 60

Methods:

  • async send_info(message: str, metadata: Dict = None) -> None: Send INFO alert
  • async send_warning(message: str, metadata: Dict = None) -> None: Send WARNING alert
  • async send_error(message: str, metadata: Dict = None) -> None: Send ERROR alert
  • async send_critical(message: str, metadata: Dict = None) -> None: Send CRITICAL alert

Example: 

import asyncio
from yunmin.core.alert_manager import AlertManager, AlertConfig

config = AlertConfig(
    telegram_enabled=True,
    telegram_bot_token="your_token",
    telegram_chat_id="your_chat_id"
)

manager = AlertManager(config)

# Send alerts
asyncio.run(manager.send_info("Bot started"))
asyncio.run(manager.send_error("Connection lost"))
asyncio.run(manager.send_critical("System failure!"))

docs.title: TradingAlerts
docs.text:
Pre-configured trading alerts.

Constructor: 

TradingAlerts(alert_manager: AlertManager)

Methods:

  • async position_opened(symbol: str, side: str, size: float, price: float) -> None
  • async position_closed(symbol: str, pnl: float, size: float, price: float) -> None
  • async risk_limit_hit(limit_type: str, current: float, max_allowed: float) -> None
  • async connection_lost(exchange: str, error: str) -> None
  • async daily_summary(trades: int, pnl: float, win_rate: float) -> None

Example: 

from yunmin.core.alert_manager import TradingAlerts, AlertManager, AlertConfig

manager = AlertManager(AlertConfig(telegram_enabled=True))
alerts = TradingAlerts(manager)

# Trading events
await alerts.position_opened("BTC/USDT", "LONG", 0.1, 45000)
await alerts.position_closed("BTC/USDT", pnl=123.45, size=0.1, price=46000)
await alerts.risk_limit_hit("max_position", current=6000, max_allowed=5000)
await alerts.daily_summary(trades=15, pnl=345.67, win_rate=60.0)

docs.title: ErrorRecoveryManager
docs.text:
Automatic retry with exponential backoff.

Constructor: 

ErrorRecoveryManager(config: RecoveryConfig)

RecoveryConfig: 

@dataclass
class RecoveryConfig:
    max_retries: int = 3
    initial_backoff_seconds: float = 1.0
    max_backoff_seconds: float = 60.0
    exponential_base: float = 2.0
    jitter: bool = True

Methods:

  • async execute_with_retry(func: Callable, *args, **kwargs) -> Any: Execute function with retry
  • async handle_connection_error(error: Exception) -> bool: Handle connection errors
  • get_recovery_state() -> RecoveryState: Get current recovery state

Example: 

from yunmin.core.error_recovery import ErrorRecoveryManager, RecoveryConfig

config = RecoveryConfig(max_retries=5, initial_backoff_seconds=2)
recovery = ErrorRecoveryManager(config)

async def fetch_balance():
    # May fail due to network issues
    return await exchange.get_balance()

# Automatic retry on failure
balance = await recovery.execute_with_retry(fetch_balance)

docs.title: Backtester
docs.text:
Historical strategy testing.

Constructor: 

Backtester(
    strategy: BaseStrategy,
    initial_capital: float = 10000,
    commission_pct: float = 0.001,
    slippage_pct: float = 0.0005,
    max_position_pct: float = 1.0
)

Methods:

  • run(data: pd.DataFrame, symbol: str = "BTC/USDT") -> Dict[str, Any]: Run backtest
  • get_equity_curve() -> pd.Series: Get equity curve
  • get_trades() -> List[Dict]: Get all trades

Returns (from run): 

{
    'total_trades': int,
    'winning_trades': int,
    'losing_trades': int,
    'win_rate': float,  # percentage
    'total_return': float,  # percentage
    'net_pnl': float,
    'sharpe_ratio': float,
    'max_drawdown': float,
    'max_drawdown_pct': float,
    'total_fees': float,
    'avg_win': float,
    'avg_loss': float,
    'best_trade': float,
    'worst_trade': float
}

Example: 

from yunmin.backtesting.backtester import Backtester
from yunmin.backtesting.data_loader import HistoricalDataLoader
from yunmin.strategy.ema_crossover import EMACrossoverStrategy

# Load data
loader = HistoricalDataLoader()
data = loader.load_csv("historical_data.csv")

# Run backtest
backtester = Backtester(
    strategy=EMACrossoverStrategy(),
    initial_capital=10000,
    commission_pct=0.001
)

metrics = backtester.run(data, symbol="BTC/USDT")
print(f"Total return: {metrics['total_return']:.2f}%")
print(f"Win rate: {metrics['win_rate']:.1f}%")
print(f"Sharpe ratio: {metrics['sharpe_ratio']:.2f}")

docs.title: BaseStrategy
docs.text:
Abstract base class for strategies.

Methods to Implement:

  • generate_signal(data: pd.DataFrame) -> Signal: Generate trading signal

Signal Enum: 

class Signal(Enum):
    LONG = "LONG"
    SHORT = "SHORT"
    CLOSE = "CLOSE"
    HOLD = "HOLD"

Example Custom Strategy: 

from yunmin.strategy.base import BaseStrategy, Signal
import pandas as pd

class MyStrategy(BaseStrategy):
    def __init__(self, threshold: float = 0.02):
        super().__init__()
        self.threshold = threshold

    def generate_signal(self, data: pd.DataFrame) -> Signal:
        if len(data) < 2:
            return Signal.HOLD

        price_change = (data['close'].iloc[-1] - data['close'].iloc[-2]) / data['close'].iloc[-2]

        if price_change > self.threshold:
            return Signal.LONG
        elif price_change < -self.threshold:
            return Signal.SHORT
        else:
            return Signal.HOLD

docs.title: BinanceConnector
docs.text:
Binance exchange integration.

Constructor: 

BinanceConnector(
    api_key: str = None,
    api_secret: str = None,
    testnet: bool = True
)

Methods:

  • get_balance() -> Dict[str, float]: Get account balance
  • get_ticker(symbol: str) -> Dict: Get current price
  • place_market_order(symbol: str, side: str, quantity: float) -> Dict: Place market order
  • place_limit_order(symbol: str, side: str, quantity: float, price: float) -> Dict: Place limit order
  • cancel_order(symbol: str, order_id: str) -> Dict: Cancel order
  • get_open_orders(symbol: str) -> List[Dict]: Get open orders
  • get_order_status(symbol: str, order_id: str) -> Dict: Get order status

Example: 

from yunmin.connectors.binance_connector import BinanceConnector

connector = BinanceConnector(testnet=True)

# Get balance
balance = connector.get_balance()
print(f"USDT: {balance['USDT']:.2f}")

# Place order
order = connector.place_market_order(
    symbol="BTC/USDT",
    side="BUY",
    quantity=0.001
)
print(f"Order ID: {order['id']}")

# Check status
status = connector.get_order_status("BTC/USDT", order['id'])
print(f"Status: {status['status']}")

docs.title: SQLiteStore
docs.text:
Database persistence layer.

Constructor: 

SQLiteStore(db_path: str = "./data/yunmin.db")

Methods:

  • save_trade(trade: Trade) -> None: Save trade to database
  • get_all_trades() -> List[Trade]: Get all trades
  • save_position(position: Position) -> None: Save position
  • get_open_positions() -> List[Position]: Get open positions
  • save_checkpoint(state: Dict) -> None: Save bot state
  • load_checkpoint() -> Optional[Dict]: Load latest checkpoint

Example: 

from yunmin.store.sqlite_store import SQLiteStore
from yunmin.core.data_contracts import Trade

store = SQLiteStore("./data/production.db")

# Save trade
trade = Trade(
    symbol="BTC/USDT",
    side="BUY",
    size=0.1,
    entry_price=45000,
    exit_price=46000,
    pnl=100,
    timestamp="2024-12-20T10:00:00"
)

store.save_trade(trade)

# Query trades
all_trades = store.get_all_trades()
print(f"Total trades: {len(all_trades)}")

docs.title: Trading Config (config/production.yaml)
docs.text:
trading:
  mode: "live"  # "dry_run" | "live"
  symbol: "BTC/USDT"
  timeframe: "5m"
  initial_capital: 10000

risk:
  max_position_pct: 0.50
  max_daily_loss: 500
  max_open_positions: 3
  stop_loss_pct: 0.02
  take_profit_pct: 0.05

strategy:
  name: "EMACrossoverStrategy"
  params:
    fast_period: 9
    slow_period: 21

alerts:
  enabled: true
  channels: ["telegram", "email", "log"]
  rate_limit_seconds: 60

recovery:
  max_retries: 3
  initial_backoff_seconds: 1
  max_backoff_seconds: 60

docs.title: CLI Commands
docs.text:
# Start bot
yunmin run --config config/production.yaml --live

# Dry-run mode
yunmin run --config config/production.yaml --dry-run

# Run backtest
yunmin backtest --data historical.csv --strategy EMA --output results.json

# Check status
yunmin status

# Generate report
yunmin report --period daily

# Close all positions
yunmin close-all --confirm

docs.title: Events Published:
docs.text:
• SIGNAL_GENERATED: Strategy generated signal
  • POSITION_OPENED: New position opened
  • POSITION_CLOSED: Position closed
  • ORDER_PLACED: Order sent to exchange
  • ORDER_FILLED: Order executed
  • RISK_LIMIT_HIT: Risk limit triggered
  • ERROR_OCCURRED: Error encountered

docs.title: Subscribe to Events:
docs.text:
from yunmin.core.trading_engine import TradingEngine

engine = TradingEngine(...)

@engine.on("POSITION_OPENED")
def handle_position(event):
    print(f"Position opened: {event.symbol} {event.side}")

@engine.on("ERROR_OCCURRED")
def handle_error(event):
    print(f"Error: {event.error}")

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text:
Code Description Action E001 Exchange connection failed Check network, API keys E002 Insufficient balance Add funds or reduce position size E003 Risk limit exceeded Wait for cooldown period E004 Invalid order parameters Check order size/price E005 Database error Check disk space, permissions E006 Strategy error Review strategy logic

Last Updated: 2024-12-20 API Version: 1.0 Python Version: 3.11+

docs.title: Contributing to Yun Min
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to Yun Min! This document provides guidelines for contributing to the project.

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text:
• Be respectful and constructive
  • Focus on what is best for the community
  • Show empathy towards other contributors

docs.title: Reporting Bugs
docs.text:
1. Check if the bug has already been reported in Issues
  2. If not, create a new issue with:
  3. Clear title and description
  4. Steps to reproduce
  5. Expected vs actual behavior
  6. Environment details (OS, Python version, etc.)

docs.title: Suggesting Features
docs.text:
1. Open an issue describing the feature
  2. Explain why it would be useful
  3. Provide examples of how it would work

docs.title: Pull Requests
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Create a new branch: git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
  3. Make your changes
  4. Add tests for new functionality
  5. Ensure all tests pass: pytest tests/
  6. Update documentation as needed
  7. Commit with clear messages
  8. Push to your fork
  9. Create a Pull Request

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
# Clone your fork
git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/yun_min.git
cd yun_min

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
pip install -e .

# Install development dependencies
pip install pytest pytest-cov black flake8 mypy

# Run tests
pytest tests/

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8 guidelines
  • Use meaningful variable and function names
  • Add docstrings to all functions and classes
  • Format code with black: black yunmin/
  • Check with flake8: flake8 yunmin/

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
• Write tests for new functionality
  • Maintain test coverage above 80%
  • Run tests before submitting PR: pytest tests/
  • Test coverage: pytest --cov=yunmin tests/

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Update README.md for user-facing changes
  • Add docstrings following Google style
  • Update examples if adding new features

docs.title: Commit Messages
docs.text:
• Use clear, descriptive commit messages
  • Start with a verb: "Add", "Fix", "Update", "Remove"
  • Keep first line under 50 characters
  • Add details in body if needed

Example: 

Add risk management circuit breaker

- Implement emergency stop mechanism
- Add tests for circuit breaker
- Update documentation

docs.title: Areas for Contribution
docs.text:
We especially welcome contributions in:

  • [ ] Backtesting engine implementation
  • [ ] ML model integration (XGBoost, LSTM, etc.)
  • [ ] LLM integration for trade analysis
  • [ ] Web dashboard UI
  • [ ] Telegram/Discord notifications
  • [ ] Additional trading strategies
  • [ ] Performance optimizations
  • [ ] Documentation improvements
  • [ ] Test coverage improvements

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text:
Feel free to: - Open an issue for questions - Start a discussion in GitHub Discussions - Contact maintainers

Thank you for contributing!

docs.title: 📊 FINAL VALIDATION RESULTS
docs.text: Дата: TBD Версия системы: Yun Min v1.0 Статус: ⏳ PENDING - Ожидание выполнения тестов

docs.title: 🎯 ЦЕЛЬ ВАЛИДАЦИИ
docs.text: Подтвердить готовность торговой системы к запуску на Testnet с реальной логикой через комплексное тестирование: 1. Backtesting - историческое тестирование (6 месяцев) 2. Walk-Forward Analysis - валидация на невиданных данных 3. Monte Carlo Simulation - стресс-тест устойчивости 4. Live Testnet Trading - малый объем реальной торговли

docs.text: Метрика Требование Backtest Walk-Forward Monte Carlo Live Test Финальный статус Win Rate ≥ 45% / 42% / 40% TBD TBD TBD TBD ⏳ Profit Factor ≥ 1.5 TBD TBD TBD TBD ⏳ Max Drawdown ≤ 15% / 20% TBD TBD TBD TBD ⏳ Sharpe Ratio ≥ 1.5 TBD TBD TBD TBD ⏳ Sortino Ratio ≥ 2.0 TBD TBD TBD TBD ⏳ Trades Executed ≥ 50 TBD TBD N/A TBD ⏳ Liquidations 0 N/A N/A N/A TBD ⏳ Margin Calls 0 N/A N/A N/A TBD ⏳

docs.title: GO (Одобрено для запуска) ✅
docs.text: Все следующие критерии должны быть выполнены: - [⏳] Win Rate > 45% в backtesting - [⏳] Win Rate > 42% в walk-forward test - [⏳] Win Rate > 40% в live test - [⏳] Profit Factor > 1.5 во всех тестах - [⏳] Max Drawdown < 15% в backtesting и walk-forward - [⏳] Max Drawdown < 20% в Monte Carlo (worst case) - [⏳] Sharpe Ratio > 1.5 - [⏳] Sortino Ratio > 2.0 - [⏳] 95%+ Monte Carlo симуляций прибыльны - [⏳] 0 ликвидаций в live test - [⏳] 0 margin calls в live test - [⏳] Margin level > 200% всегда - [⏳] API и alerts работают стабильно - [⏳] Funding costs < прибыль

docs.title: NO-GO (Требуется дополнительная работа) ❌
docs.text: Любой из следующих критериев провален: - [ ] Win Rate < 45% в backtesting - [ ] Win Rate < 42% в walk-forward - [ ] Win Rate < 40% в live test - [ ] Profit Factor < 1.5 - [ ] Max Drawdown > 15% (backtest/walk-forward) - [ ] Max Drawdown > 20% (Monte Carlo) - [ ] Sharpe Ratio < 1.0 - [ ] Sortino Ratio < 1.5 - [ ] Любые ликвидации в live test - [ ] Любые margin calls в live test - [ ] Проблемы с execution или alerts - [ ] Funding costs превышают прибыль

Подготовил: Yun Min Development Team Дата: TBD Версия документа: 1.0

docs.title: 🚦 GO / NO-GO DECISION FRAMEWORK
docs.text: Документ: Фреймворк принятия решения о запуске Версия: 1.0 Дата: November 2025

docs.title: 🎯 ЦЕЛЬ ДОКУМЕНТА
docs.text: Этот документ определяет четкие критерии и процесс принятия решения GO/NO-GO для запуска торговой системы Yun Min на Production. Решение основывается на результатах комплексной валидации (Backtesting, Walk-Forward, Monte Carlo, Live Testnet).

docs.title: ✅ GO CRITERIA (Критерии для запуска)
docs.text: Для принятия решения GO ВСЕ следующие критерии должны быть выполнены:

docs.title: 1.1 Win Rate (Процент выигрышных сделок)
docs.text:
✅ Backtesting:    Win Rate ≥ 45%
✅ Walk-Forward:   Win Rate ≥ 42%
✅ Live Testnet:   Win Rate ≥ 40%

Обоснование:
- Win Rate > 45% показывает стабильную прибыльность
- Градация допускает небольшое снижение на out-of-sample
- 40%+ на live trading достаточно при хорошем R:R

docs.title: 1.2 Profit Factor
docs.text:
✅ Все тесты: Profit Factor ≥ 1.5

Обоснование:
- PF > 1.5 означает, что прибыль в 1.5x раза больше убытков
- Достаточный буфер для покрытия комиссий и проскальзывания
- Устойчивость к временным просадкам

docs.title: 1.3 Total Return
docs.text:
✅ Backtesting:  Total Return > 20% за 6 месяцев
✅ Walk-Forward: Total Return > 15% per window
✅ Live Testnet: Total Return > 5% за неделю (extrapolated)

Обоснование:
- Целевая доходность: 30-40% в месяц
- Консервативные ожидания для валидации

docs.title: 2.1 Maximum Drawdown
docs.text:
✅ Backtesting:     Max DD ≤ 15%
✅ Walk-Forward:    Max DD ≤ 15%
✅ Monte Carlo:     Max DD ≤ 20% (worst case)
✅ Live Testnet:    Max DD ≤ 10%

Обоснование:
- Drawdown < 15% позволяет психологически комфортную торговлю
- Monte Carlo допускает 20% в worst-case сценарии
- Live test должен показывать лучше из-за короткого периода

docs.title: 2.2 Sharpe Ratio
docs.text:
✅ Все тесты: Sharpe Ratio ≥ 1.5

Обоснование:
- Sharpe > 1.5 показывает хорошее соотношение риск/доходность
- Выше среднего для крипто-рынка (обычно 1.0-1.2)
- Достаточный буфер для вариаций на рынке

docs.title: 2.3 Sortino Ratio
docs.text:
✅ Все тесты: Sortino Ratio ≥ 2.0

Обоснование:
- Sortino учитывает только downside volatility
- > 2.0 показывает, что стратегия хорошо контролирует риски
- Выше Sharpe из-за фокуса на отрицательных отклонениях

docs.title: 3.1 Profitable Simulations
docs.text:
✅ Прибыльные симуляции ≥ 95% (950+ из 1000)

Обоснование:
- 95%+ показывает независимость от порядка сделок
- Стратегия работает в большинстве случайных последовательностей
- Высокая устойчивость к вариациям рынка

docs.title: 3.2 Drawdown Distribution
docs.text:
✅ 95-й процентиль Max DD ≤ 20%

Обоснование:
- В 95% случаев drawdown не превышает 20%
- Остальные 5% - экстремальные сценарии
- Приемлемый уровень риска для системы

docs.title: 4.1 Degradation from Train to Test
docs.text:
✅ Degradation ≥ -30%

Обоснование:
- Test results могут быть хуже train на 30%
- Это нормальная деградация для out-of-sample
- Больше -30% указывает на overfitting

docs.title: 4.2 Profitable Windows
docs.text:
✅ Profitable Test Windows ≥ 70%

Обоснование:
- Минимум 70% окон должны быть прибыльны на test
- Показывает стабильность на невиданных данных

docs.title: 5.1 Liquidations & Margin Calls
docs.text:
✅ Liquidations = 0 (обязательно!)
✅ Margin Calls = 0 (обязательно!)

Обоснование:
- Любая ликвидация = INSTANT NO-GO
- Показывает неадекватное управление рисками
- Margin calls = предупреждение о проблемах

docs.title: 5.2 Margin Level
docs.text:
✅ Margin Level ≥ 200% в ЛЮБОЕ время

Обоснование:
- 200%+ обеспечивает безопасный буфер
- Защита от неожиданных движений рынка
- Критически важно для leverage trading

docs.title: 5.3 Execution Quality
docs.text:
✅ API Rate Limits: Не превышены
✅ Execution Latency: < 500ms average
✅ Order Fill Rate: ≥ 98%
✅ Telegram Alerts Delivery: ≥ 95%

Обоснование:
- Система должна работать стабильно технически
- Задержки > 500ms могут влиять на прибыльность
- Alerts критичны для мониторинга

docs.title: 6.1 Transaction Costs
docs.text:
✅ Net Profit > Total Fees (после комиссий)
✅ Funding Costs < 50% от прибыли

Обоснование:
- Прибыль должна покрывать все издержки
- Funding costs не должны съедать большую часть прибыли
- Положительный Net P&L после всех costs

docs.title: 6.2 Minimum Trades
docs.text:
✅ Backtesting: ≥ 50 сделок (статистическая значимость)
✅ Live Test: ≥ 20 сделок (за неделю)

Обоснование:
- Достаточная статистическая выборка
- Слишком мало сделок = недостаточно данных

docs.title: ❌ NO-GO CRITERIA (Критерии отказа от запуска)
docs.text: При наличии ЛЮБОГО из следующих критериев решение должно быть NO-GO:

docs.title: 🚨 CRITICAL (Критические - абсолютный NO-GO)
docs.text:
❌ Liquidations > 0 в live test
   → INSTANT NO-GO, требуется пересмотр risk management

❌ Margin Calls > 0 в live test
   → Система недостаточно безопасна

❌ Margin Level < 150% в любой момент
   → Высокий риск ликвидации

❌ System crash или critical error в live test
   → Технические проблемы требуют исправления

❌ Win Rate < 35% в любом тесте
   → Стратегия не работает

❌ Profit Factor < 1.0 в любом тесте
   → Убыточная стратегия

docs.title: ⚠️ HIGH PRIORITY (Высокий приоритет)
docs.text:
❌ Max Drawdown > 20% в backtesting
   → Неприемлемый уровень риска

❌ Max Drawdown > 25% в Monte Carlo worst case
   → Экстремальные просадки возможны

❌ Sharpe Ratio < 1.0
   → Плохое соотношение риск/доходность

❌ Monte Carlo profitable < 85%
   → Высокая зависимость от порядка сделок

❌ Walk-Forward degradation < -50%
   → Серьезный overfitting

docs.title: ⚡ MEDIUM PRIORITY (Средний приоритет)
docs.text:
❌ Win Rate < 40% в backtesting
   → Требуется улучшение стратегии

❌ Profit Factor < 1.3
   → Недостаточная прибыльность

❌ Execution latency > 1000ms average
   → Технические проблемы

❌ Net profit < Total fees
   → Экономически нежизнеспособно

❌ Funding costs > profit
   → Carry costs слишком высоки

docs.title: 📊 DECISION MATRIX
docs.text:
Категория Критерий Weight Threshold Status Performance Win Rate (Backtest) HIGH ≥ 45% ⏳ Win Rate (Walk-Fwd) HIGH ≥ 42% ⏳ Win Rate (Live) HIGH ≥ 40% ⏳ Profit Factor HIGH ≥ 1.5 ⏳ Risk Max Drawdown (Backtest) CRITICAL ≤ 15% ⏳ Max Drawdown (MC Worst) CRITICAL ≤ 20% ⏳ Sharpe Ratio HIGH ≥ 1.5 ⏳ Sortino Ratio MEDIUM ≥ 2.0 ⏳ Robustness MC Profitable % HIGH ≥ 95% ⏳ WF Degradation HIGH ≥ -30% ⏳ Safety Liquidations CRITICAL = 0 ⏳ Margin Calls CRITICAL = 0 ⏳ Margin Level CRITICAL ≥ 200% ⏳ Technical API Rate Limits MEDIUM OK ⏳ Execution Latency MEDIUM < 500ms ⏳ Alerts Delivery MEDIUM ≥ 95% ⏳ Economic Net Profit > Fees HIGH YES ⏳ Funding < 50% Profit MEDIUM YES ⏳

Решение: - GO: Все CRITICAL = ✅, Все HIGH = ✅, ≥ 80% MEDIUM = ✅ - NO-GO: Любой CRITICAL = ❌ ИЛИ ≥ 2 HIGH = ❌

docs.title: Шаг 1: Сбор данных
docs.text:
[ ] Завершить все 4 типа тестов
[ ] Собрать все метрики в FINAL_VALIDATION_RESULTS.md
[ ] Проверить качество и полноту данных

docs.title: Шаг 2: Оценка Critical Criteria
docs.text:
[ ] Проверить: Liquidations = 0
[ ] Проверить: Margin Calls = 0
[ ] Проверить: Margin Level ≥ 200%
[ ] Проверить: Max DD ≤ 15% (backtest)
[ ] Проверить: Max DD ≤ 20% (MC)

Если ЛЮБОЙ критерий провален → INSTANT NO-GO

docs.title: Шаг 3: Оценка High Priority Criteria
docs.text:
[ ] Win Rate во всех тестах
[ ] Profit Factor во всех тестах
[ ] Sharpe Ratio
[ ] Monte Carlo profitable %
[ ] Walk-Forward degradation

Если ≥ 2 критериев провалены → NO-GO

docs.title: Шаг 4: Оценка Medium Priority Criteria
docs.text:
[ ] Sortino Ratio
[ ] Execution latency
[ ] Alerts delivery
[ ] Funding costs
[ ] Net profit vs fees

Если < 80% критериев пройдено → рассмотреть NO-GO

docs.title: Шаг 5: Финальное решение
docs.text:
Проанализировать все результаты холистически:
- Есть ли паттерны проблем?
- Все ли критические аспекты покрыты?
- Какой уровень уверенности в системе?

Принять решение: GO или NO-GO

docs.title: Immediate Actions (Сразу после GO)
docs.text:
1. Документировать решение
  2. Записать все результаты
  3. Сохранить все метрики

  4. Создать snapshot кодовой базы

  5. Подготовить Production Environment

  6. Настроить production config
  7. Проверить API ключи

  8. Настроить мониторинг

  9. Запустить с минимальным капиталом

  10. Начать с $100 USD
  11. Максимум 2 символа (BTC, ETH)
  12. Максимум 3 параллельные позиции

docs.title: Week 1-2: Monitoring Phase
docs.text:
1. Intensive Monitoring
  2. Ежедневная проверка метрик
  3. Проверка alerts

  4. Анализ execution quality

  5. Performance Tracking

  6. Сравнение с backtest результатами
  7. Отслеживание drawdown
  8. Margin level monitoring

docs.title: Week 3-4: Scale Up Phase (if stable)
docs.text:
1. Gradual Scale Up
  2. Увеличить капитал до $500
  3. Добавить 1-2 символа
  4. Увеличить max позиций до 5

docs.title: Month 2+: Full Production
docs.text:
1. Full Deployment
  2. Полный капитал (по решению)
  3. Все symbols
  4. Advanced features (если есть)

См. также: LIVE_LAUNCH_PLAN.md для детального плана запуска

docs.title: Immediate Actions
docs.text:
1. Остановить все live trading
  2. Проанализировать причины
  3. Какие критерии провалены?
  4. Почему они провалены?
  5. Какие есть паттерны?

docs.title: Analysis Phase
docs.text:
1. Root Cause Analysis 

    Для каждого проваленного критерия:
- Определить корневую причину
- Оценить сложность исправления
- Приоритизировать по impact

  2. Impact Assessment 

    Оценить:
- Насколько серьезна проблема?
- Требуется ли полный редизайн?
- Сколько времени на исправление?

docs.title: Improvement Plan
docs.text:
1. Создать план улучшений 

    Для каждой проблемы:
- Определить action items
- Назначить ответственных
- Установить дедлайны

  2. Приоритизация 

    CRITICAL → Fix immediately
HIGH     → Fix before re-test
MEDIUM   → Nice to have

docs.title: Re-validation
docs.text:
1. Повторная валидация 
    После исправлений:
- Повторить проваленные тесты
- Убедиться в улучшении
- Повторить GO/NO-GO процесс

docs.title: GO Decision Template
docs.text:

docs.title: 🔄 REVIEW & UPDATE
docs.text:
Этот документ должен регулярно пересматриваться: - После каждой валидации - обновить критерии на основе learnings - Ежемесячно - проверить актуальность thresholds - При серьезных изменениях стратегии - пересмотреть весь процесс

Версия: 1.0 Последнее обновление: November 2025 Следующий review: December 2025

docs.text:

max_position_size: 15% of capital
max_total_exposure: 50% of capital
max_loss_per_trade: 2%
max_loss_per_day: 5%
max_drawdown: 15%

docs.title: Circuit Breakers
docs.text:
Level 1: Warning (Yellow) 

Trigger: Daily loss > 3%
Action:
- Reduce position size by 50%
- No new positions until recovery
- Intensive monitoring

Level 2: Critical (Red) 

Trigger: Daily loss > 5% OR Margin < 200%
Action:
- Stop all new positions
- Close half of open positions
- Emergency review meeting

Level 3: Emergency Stop (Black) 

Trigger: Daily loss > 10% OR Margin < 180% OR Critical system error
Action:
- STOP ALL TRADING
- Close all positions
- Full investigation required
- Cannot restart without approval

P1 - High: Significant loss, system errors
P2 - Medium: Performance issues, alerts

docs.title: Response Procedures

P0 - Critical Incident 

Response Time: Immediate (< 5 minutes)

Actions:
1. Execute emergency stop
2. Notify all team members
3. Close positions if needed
4. Investigate root cause
5. Document incident
6. Get approval before restart

P1 - High Severity 

Response Time: < 30 minutes

Actions:
1. Assess situation
2. Apply circuit breaker if needed
3. Investigate issue
4. Implement fix
5. Monitor closely
6. Document incident

P2 - Medium Severity 

Response Time: < 2 hours

Actions:
1. Log incident
2. Investigate when possible
3. Plan fix
4. Implement during low-activity period
5. Update monitoring

docs.title: 📱 Telegram Bot Alerts - Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get instant trading notifications on your phone in under 5 minutes!

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text:
• 🟢 Trade Alerts: Real-time BUY/SELL notifications with P&L
  • 🔴 Critical Alerts: Errors, drawdowns, system failures (with sound)
  • 📊 Daily Summaries: Performance reports twice daily (silent)
  • 🤖 Bot Lifecycle: Startup/shutdown notifications
  • ⚙️ Configurable: Choose which alerts you want to receive

docs.title: Step 1: Create Your Bot
docs.text:
1. Open Telegram and search for @BotFather
  2. Send: /newbot
  3. Choose a name: YunMin Trading Alerts (or your preference)
  4. Choose username: yunmin_alerts_bot (must end with 'bot')
  5. Copy the bot token you receive (looks like 123456:ABCdefgh...)

docs.title: Step 2: Get Your Chat ID
docs.text:
1. Open Telegram and search for @userinfobot
  2. Start a chat and send any message
  3. Copy your ID (the number shown)

docs.title: Step 3: Configure YunMin
docs.text:
Run the interactive setup wizard:

python setup_telegram.py

Or manually edit config/default.yaml:

telegram:
  enabled: true
  bot_token: "YOUR_BOT_TOKEN_HERE"  # From @BotFather
  chat_id: "YOUR_CHAT_ID_HERE"      # From @userinfobot

  alerts:
    trade_execution: true      # Alert on every trade
    daily_summary: true        # Daily performance report
    critical_only: false       # Only critical alerts
    drawdown_threshold: 10.0   # Alert if drawdown > 10%
    error_alerts: true         # Alert on errors
    startup_alert: true        # Alert when bot starts
    shutdown_alert: true       # Alert when bot stops

docs.title: Step 4: Test It!
docs.text:
python -c "
import asyncio
from yunmin.notifications.telegram_bot import TelegramBot

async def test():
    bot = TelegramBot('YOUR_TOKEN', 'YOUR_CHAT_ID')
    await bot.test_connection()

asyncio.run(test())
"

You should receive a test message on Telegram! 🎉

Run the unit tests:

Run manual verification:

docs.title: 🛠️ Integration
docs.text:
The Telegram bot is automatically integrated into the trading bot. Alerts are sent for:

  • Trade Execution (BUY/SELL)
  • Position Opened/Closed
  • Bot Started/Stopped
  • Errors and Exceptions
  • Drawdown Warnings

No additional code required - just configure and run!

docs.title: TelegramBot Class
docs.text:
from yunmin.notifications.telegram_bot import TelegramBot

bot = TelegramBot(token="123:ABC", chat_id="456")

# Send trade alert
await bot.alert_trade(
    side="BUY",
    symbol="BTC/USDT",
    price=50000.0,
    size=0.01,
    reason="RSI oversold",
    portfolio_pnl=100.0,
    portfolio_pnl_pct=1.5,
    open_positions=1
)

# Send critical alert (with sound)
await bot.alert_critical(
    title="System Error",
    message="Exchange API connection lost",
    action="Retrying in 30 seconds..."
)

# Send daily summary (silent)
await bot.alert_daily_summary(
    trades_today=10,
    win_rate=60.0,
    pnl_today=250.0,
    pnl_today_pct=2.5,
    total_capital=10250.0,
    open_positions=2
)

docs.title: Singleton Pattern
docs.text:
from yunmin.notifications.telegram_bot import get_telegram_bot

# Get the global instance
bot = get_telegram_bot()

# Or initialize with credentials
bot = get_telegram_bot(token="123:ABC", chat_id="456")

docs.title: 🔒 Security
docs.text:
• ✅ Bot token and chat ID stored in config (not hardcoded)
  • ✅ No external dependencies except aiohttp
  • ✅ Graceful degradation if Telegram unavailable
  • ✅ No sensitive data in alerts (only trading info)
  • ✅ Passed CodeQL security scan

docs.title: "Bot not configured" message
docs.text: Make sure: 1. telegram.enabled: true in config 2. Valid bot_token and chat_id 3. Token doesn't start with "YOUR_"

docs.title: No messages received
docs.text:
1. Start a chat with your bot (press START button)
  2. Verify chat_id is correct (use @userinfobot)
  3. Check bot token is valid
  4. Verify internet connection

docs.title: "aiohttp not installed" error
docs.text:
pip install aiohttp>=3.9.0

Or reinstall dependencies:

pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: 📝 Notes
docs.text:
• Telegram API is 100% free forever
  • No rate limits for personal use
  • Messages delivered within 1-2 seconds
  • Works globally (no geographic restrictions)
  • Can mute specific alert types in config

docs.title: WebSocket Streaming Integration Guide
docs.text: This guide explains how to use the WebSocket layer for real-time market data streaming in YunMin trading bot.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The WebSocket layer provides real-time market data with sub-second latency, replacing the traditional 5-minute REST API polling. This enables:

  • ⚡ 300x faster updates (1 second vs 5 minutes)
  • 🛑 Instant stop-loss execution
  • 📊 Real-time price monitoring
  • 💰 Zero API rate limits (unlimited streaming)

docs.title: 1. Basic Usage
docs.text:
import asyncio
from yunmin.core.websocket_layer import WebSocketLayer

async def main():
    # Initialize WebSocket layer
    ws_layer = WebSocketLayer(
        api_key="",  # Not needed for public streams
        api_secret="",
        testnet=False
    )

    # Define callback for price updates
    async def on_trade(event):
        print(f"💰 BTC Price: ${event.price:,.2f}")

    # Subscribe to real-time trades
    await ws_layer.subscribe_trades("BTCUSDT")
    ws_layer.register_trade_callback(on_trade)

    # Run WebSocket
    await ws_layer.run()

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: 2. Running the Demo
docs.text:
A complete example is provided:

python examples/websocket_demo.py

This demonstrates: - Kline/candle updates (5-minute intervals) - Trade updates (every trade) - Ticker updates (24hr statistics)

docs.title: Option 1: Real-time Price Monitoring
docs.text:
Add to YunMinBot.__init__():

from yunmin.core.websocket_layer import WebSocketLayer

class YunMinBot:
    def __init__(self, config: YunMinConfig):
        # ... existing initialization ...

        # Initialize WebSocket for real-time updates
        self.ws_layer = WebSocketLayer(
            api_key=config.exchange.api_key,
            api_secret=config.exchange.api_secret,
            testnet=config.exchange.testnet
        )
        self.latest_price = 0.0

docs.title: Option 2: Real-time Stop-Loss Monitoring
docs.text:
Add price update handler:

async def _on_price_update(self, trade_event):
    """Handle real-time price updates."""
    self.latest_price = trade_event.price

    # Update dashboard
    if hasattr(self, 'dashboard'):
        self.dashboard.update_price(trade_event.price)

    # Check stop-losses
    await self._check_stop_losses(trade_event.price)

async def _check_stop_losses(self, current_price: float):
    """Monitor positions and trigger stop-losses."""
    for position in self.pnl_tracker.open_positions.values():
        if position['side'] == 'LONG':
            # Check stop-loss for long position
            stop_loss = position['entry_price'] * (1 - self.config.risk.stop_loss_pct)
            if current_price <= stop_loss:
                logger.warning(f"🛑 Stop-loss hit: {current_price} <= {stop_loss}")
                await self.close_position(position['symbol'], 'LONG', current_price)

        elif position['side'] == 'SHORT':
            # Check stop-loss for short position
            stop_loss = position['entry_price'] * (1 + self.config.risk.stop_loss_pct)
            if current_price >= stop_loss:
                logger.warning(f"🛑 Stop-loss hit: {current_price} >= {stop_loss}")
                await self.close_position(position['symbol'], 'SHORT', current_price)

docs.title: Option 3: Strategy Signals from Candles
docs.text:
Use real-time candles for strategy analysis:

async def _on_candle_closed(self, kline_event):
    """Handle closed candle for strategy analysis."""
    if not kline_event.is_final:
        return  # Only analyze closed candles

    logger.info(f"🕯️ New candle: {kline_event.close:.2f}")

    # Convert to DataFrame format
    new_candle = {
        'timestamp': kline_event.ts_close,
        'open': kline_event.open,
        'high': kline_event.high,
        'low': kline_event.low,
        'close': kline_event.close,
        'volume': kline_event.volume
    }

    # Add to historical data
    self.historical_data = self.historical_data.append(
        new_candle, ignore_index=True
    )

    # Run strategy analysis
    signal = self.strategy.analyze(self.historical_data)

    if signal.type in [SignalType.BUY, SignalType.SELL]:
        await self.process_signal(signal, kline_event.close)

docs.title: Starting WebSocket with Bot
docs.text:
Modify run() method:

async def run_async(self):
    """Run bot with WebSocket streaming."""
    # Register callbacks
    self.ws_layer.register_trade_callback(self._on_price_update)
    self.ws_layer.register_kline_callback(self._on_candle_closed)

    # Subscribe to streams
    await self.ws_layer.subscribe_trades(self.config.trading.symbol)
    await self.ws_layer.subscribe_kline(
        self.config.trading.symbol,
        self.config.trading.timeframe
    )

    # Start WebSocket in background
    ws_task = asyncio.create_task(self.ws_layer.run())

    try:
        # Main loop
        while self.is_running:
            await asyncio.sleep(1)  # Just monitor
    finally:
        await self.ws_layer.close()
        ws_task.cancel()

def run(self):
    """Wrapper to run async bot."""
    asyncio.run(self.run_async())

docs.title: 1. Kline Stream (Candles)
docs.text:
Use case: Strategy analysis on closed candles

await ws_layer.subscribe_kline("BTCUSDT", "5m")
ws_layer.register_kline_callback(on_candle)

Event fields: - symbol, timeframe - open, high, low, close, volume - is_final (True when candle closes)

docs.title: 2. Trade Stream
docs.text:
Use case: Real-time price monitoring, stop-loss checks

await ws_layer.subscribe_trades("BTCUSDT")
ws_layer.register_trade_callback(on_trade)

Event fields: - symbol, price, quantity - timestamp - is_buyer_maker

docs.title: 3. Ticker Stream
docs.text:
Use case: 24hr statistics, volume tracking

await ws_layer.subscribe_ticker("BTCUSDT")
ws_layer.register_ticker_callback(on_ticker)

Event fields: - symbol, price - price_change, price_change_pct - volume, quote_volume

docs.title: Multi-Symbol Support
docs.text:
Monitor multiple trading pairs simultaneously:

symbols = ['BTCUSDT', 'ETHUSDT', 'BNBUSDT']

for symbol in symbols:
    await ws_layer.subscribe_trades(symbol)
    await ws_layer.subscribe_kline(symbol, '5m')

# All streams will be multiplexed in one WebSocket connection

docs.title: Error Handling & Reconnection
docs.text:
The WebSocket layer handles:

  • Auto-reconnection: Exponential backoff up to 10 attempts
  • Connection monitoring: Ping/pong every 30 seconds
  • Error callbacks: Get notified of issues
async def on_error(error: Exception):
    logger.error(f"WebSocket error: {error}")
    # Implement fallback to REST API if needed

ws_layer.register_error_callback(on_error)

docs.title: Performance Comparison
docs.text:
Metric REST API (Old) WebSocket (New) Update Frequency Every 5 minutes Every 1 second Latency ~300 seconds ~50 milliseconds API Calls 120/minute 0 (streaming) Rate Limits 1200/minute Unlimited Data Freshness Stale (5 min old) Real-time Stop-Loss Speed Slow (5 min delay) Instant (<1 sec)

Result: 300x faster! ⚡

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
Run the unit tests:

pytest tests/test_websocket.py -v

All 15 tests should pass, covering: - Connection handling - Stream subscriptions - Message parsing (kline, trade, ticker) - Callback execution (sync & async) - Reconnection logic - Multi-symbol support

docs.title: Binance WebSocket Documentation
docs.text:
Official docs: https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/spot/en/#websocket-market-streams

Available streams: - <symbol>@kline_<interval> - Kline/Candlestick - <symbol>@trade - Individual trades - <symbol>@ticker - 24hr ticker statistics - <symbol>@depth - Order book depth - <symbol>@aggTrade - Aggregated trades

Example URL: 

wss://stream.binance.com:9443/ws/btcusdt@kline_5m

docs.title: WebSocket not connecting
docs.text:
1. Check internet connection
  2. Verify Binance API is accessible
  3. Check firewall settings (port 9443)

docs.title: Callbacks not firing
docs.text:
1. Ensure streams are subscribed before calling run()
  2. Register callbacks before subscribing
  3. Check event type in Binance message format

docs.title: High memory usage
docs.text:
Limit historical data accumulation:

# Keep only last 1000 candles
if len(self.historical_data) > 1000:
    self.historical_data = self.historical_data.tail(1000)

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use trade stream for real-time prices: Fastest updates
  2. Use kline stream for strategy signals: Analyze closed candles
  3. Implement error callbacks: Handle disconnections gracefully
  4. Limit subscriptions: Don't subscribe to too many symbols at once
  5. Monitor memory: Clear old data periodically
  6. Test on testnet first: Validate before going live

docs.title: 🎯 Что такое Yun Min?
docs.text: Yun Min (云敏, "Облачная Быстрота") - это инновационный торговый бот для криптовалютных фьючерсов, который использует искусственный интеллект Grok AI от X.AI для принятия торговых решений в режиме реального времени.

docs.title: Ключевые характеристики
docs.text:
• 🤖 AI-управление: Каждое торговое решение принимается через Grok AI API (модель grok-2-1212)
  • 📊 Технический анализ: Использует RSI, EMA, волатильность и объёмы для принятия решений
  • 🛡️ Управление рисками: Автоматические Stop-Loss и Take-Profit для каждой позиции
  • 🔄 24/7 работа: Полностью автономная торговая система
  • 📈 Реал-тайм мониторинг: SQLite база данных для отслеживания всех сделок
  • 🎯 Фьючерсная торговля: Поддержка LONG и SHORT позиций

docs.title: Технологический стек
docs.text:
Core: - Python 3.9+ - CCXT (подключение к биржам) - Pandas, NumPy (обработка данных)

AI/ML: - OpenAI SDK (для Grok AI) - Scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM - PyTorch, TensorFlow - Stable-baselines3 (RL)

Data & Storage: - SQLAlchemy (ORM) - SQLite/PostgreSQL - Redis (кеширование) - FAISS (векторное хранилище)

Web & API: - FastAPI - Uvicorn - Pydantic

Monitoring: - Prometheus - Loguru - Rich (CLI)

docs.title: Версия V4 - В разработке
docs.text:
Планируемые улучшения:

LONG позиции:
  - Stop Loss: -2% → -3% (расширен)
  - Take Profit: +3% → +4% (увеличен)

SHORT позиции:
  - Stop Loss: -2% (без изменений, работает отлично)
  - Take Profit: +3% (без изменений)

Общие изменения:
  - Confidence threshold: 50% → 65%
  - Добавление MACD и Bollinger Bands для LONG
  - Фильтр трендов

docs.title: 1. Grok AI Decision Making
docs.text:
Система использует Grok AI для анализа рыночной ситуации:

from openai import OpenAI

client = OpenAI(
    api_key=os.environ.get("GROK_API_KEY"),
    base_url="https://api.x.ai/v1"
)

# Запрос решения от Grok
response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="grok-2-1212",
    messages=[{
        "role": "user",
        "content": f"Analyze: RSI={rsi}, Price={price}, Trend={trend}"
    }]
)

docs.title: 2. Автоматическое управление позициями
docs.text:
• Открытие позиций: На основе сигналов Grok AI
  • Stop-Loss: Автоматическая защита от убытков
  • Take-Profit: Автоматическая фиксация прибыли
  • Трекинг: Все позиции сохраняются в БД

docs.title: 3. Технический анализ
docs.text: Система вычисляет и использует: - RSI (Relative Strength Index) - EMA (Exponential Moving Average) - Волатильность - Объёмы торгов - MACD (планируется) - Bollinger Bands (планируется)

docs.title: 4. Управление рисками
docs.text:
Текущие параметры:
  - Максимум на позицию: 10% капитала
  - Stop-Loss: 2-3%
  - Take-Profit: 3-4%
  - Максимум открытых позиций: 10
  - Минимальная уверенность: 50-65%

docs.text:
import sqlite3
import pandas as pd

# Подключение к БД
conn = sqlite3.connect('yunmin.db')

# Статистика позиций
df = pd.read_sql("""
    SELECT side, 
           COUNT(*) as total,
           SUM(CASE WHEN status='CLOSED' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as closed,
           AVG(realized_pnl) as avg_pnl
    FROM positions
    GROUP BY side
""", conn)

print(df)

docs.title: 📈 Ключевые метрики
docs.text: Система отслеживает: - P&L (Profit and Loss) - Win Rate (процент выигрышных сделок) - Maximum Drawdown (максимальная просадка) - Sharpe Ratio (соотношение доходности к риску) - Order Fill Rates (процент исполненных ордеров) - Latency (задержка исполнения)

docs.title: Встроенная защита
docs.text:
1. API ключи: Никогда не должны иметь права на вывод средств
  2. Testnet: Всегда начинайте с тестовой сети
  3. Dry-Run: Первый этап тестирования без реальных ордеров
  4. Rate Limiting: Защита от превышения лимитов биржи
  5. Circuit Breaker: Автоматическая остановка при критических ситуациях
  6. Risk Limits: Ограничения на размер позиций и кредитное плечо

docs.title: Advanced AI Strategy Framework - Complete Guide
Overview
docs.text: The Advanced AI Strategy Framework is a comprehensive trading system that combines cutting-edge AI technology with professional risk management and backtesting capabilities.

docs.title: 1. Multi-Model AI Ensemble (yunmin/strategy/ai_ensemble.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Aggregate predictions from multiple Large Language Models for more reliable trading signals.

Features: - Integration with 3 LLM providers: - Groq (Llama 3.3 70B) - OpenRouter (Llama 3.3 70B) - OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) - Confidence-based weighted voting - Disagreement detection with fallback logic - Meta-analysis for consensus signals

Usage: 

from yunmin.strategy.ai_ensemble import AIEnsembleStrategy

# Initialize with API keys
strategy = AIEnsembleStrategy(
    groq_api_key="your_groq_key",
    openrouter_api_key="your_openrouter_key",
    openai_api_key="your_openai_key",
    consensus_threshold=0.6  # 60% agreement required
)

# Analyze market data
signal = strategy.analyze(df)

print(f"Signal: {signal.type.value}")
print(f"Confidence: {signal.confidence}")
print(f"Reasoning: {signal.reason}")

# Check disagreements
disagreements = strategy.get_disagreement_log()

Expected Results: - 30-40% reduction in false signals through consensus - Higher win rate due to multi-model agreement - Automatic fallback when models are unavailable

docs.title: 2. Adaptive Position Sizing Optimizer (yunmin/strategy/position_optimizer.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Dynamically adjust position sizes based on market volatility and portfolio performance.

Features: - ATR-based volatility analysis - Kelly Criterion for optimal sizing - Performance-based adjustments (win/loss streaks) - Dynamic risk management based on drawdown - Automatic position reduction in high-risk scenarios

Usage: 

from yunmin.strategy.position_optimizer import PositionOptimizer

# Initialize optimizer
optimizer = PositionOptimizer(
    initial_capital=10000.0,
    base_risk_pct=0.02,  # 2% base risk
    max_position_pct=0.10  # Max 10% per trade
)

# Calculate position size
position = optimizer.calculate_position_size(
    df=market_data,
    signal_confidence=0.8
)

print(f"Position Size: ${position.adjusted_size:.2f}")
print(f"Volatility Factor: {position.volatility_factor:.2f}")
print(f"Performance Factor: {position.performance_factor:.2f}")

# Record trade results
optimizer.record_trade(profit_loss=150.0, was_win=True)

# Get statistics
stats = optimizer.get_statistics()
print(f"Win Rate: {stats['win_rate']*100:.1f}%")
print(f"Max Drawdown: {stats['max_drawdown']*100:.1f}%")

Expected Results: - 20-30% reduction in maximum drawdown - More stable equity curve - Automatic position reduction after losses - Position increases after winning streaks

docs.title: 3. Market Regime Detection (yunmin/ml/regime_detector.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Automatically detect market regime (trending, ranging, volatile) and adapt strategy accordingly.

Features: - ADX (Average Directional Index) for trend strength - Bollinger Band width for volatility measurement - Price action pattern detection - Three regime classifications: - TRENDING (ADX > 25): Aggressive positioning allowed - RANGING (ADX < 20): Require higher confidence, smaller positions - VOLATILE (BB width > threshold): Reduce leverage significantly

Usage: 

from yunmin.ml.regime_detector import RegimeDetector

# Initialize detector
detector = RegimeDetector(
    adx_trending_threshold=25.0,
    adx_ranging_threshold=20.0,
    bb_volatility_threshold=0.04
)

# Detect regime
analysis = detector.detect_regime(df)

print(f"Regime: {analysis.regime.value}")
print(f"Trend: {analysis.trend_direction.value}")
print(f"ADX: {analysis.trend_strength:.1f}")
print(f"Volatility: {analysis.volatility*100:.2f}%")

# Get strategy adjustments
adjustments = detector.get_strategy_adjustments(analysis.regime)
print(f"Required Confidence: {adjustments['required_confidence']}")
print(f"Position Sizing: {adjustments['position_sizing']*100:.0f}%")

# Visualize
print(detector.visualize_regime(analysis))

Expected Results: - Avoid whipsaw losses in ranging markets - Maximize profits in trending markets - Automatic leverage reduction in volatile conditions

docs.title: 4. Advanced Backtesting Suite (yunmin/core/backtester.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Comprehensive backtesting framework with professional-grade validation and optimization.

Features: - Walk-forward validation for robust testing - Monte Carlo simulations for risk assessment - Out-of-sample testing to prevent overfitting - Parameter optimization (grid search, genetic algorithms) - Comprehensive metrics: - Sharpe Ratio - Sortino Ratio - Calmar Ratio - Max Drawdown - Win Rate - Profit Factor - Expectancy - Recovery Factor - HTML report generation

Usage:

docs.title: Basic Backtest
docs.text:
from yunmin.core.backtester import AdvancedBacktester

backtester = AdvancedBacktester(symbol="BTC/USDT", timeframe="5m")

# Run backtest
result = backtester.run(
    strategy=my_strategy,
    data=historical_data,
    initial_capital=10000.0,
    commission=0.001,  # 0.1%
    slippage=0.0005    # 0.05%
)

print(f"Total Profit: ${result.total_profit:.2f}")
print(f"Win Rate: {result.win_rate*100:.1f}%")
print(f"Sharpe Ratio: {result.sharpe_ratio:.2f}")
print(f"Max Drawdown: {result.max_drawdown*100:.2f}%")

docs.title: Walk-Forward Validation
docs.text:
# Validate strategy robustness
results = backtester.walk_forward_validation(
    strategy_class=MyStrategyClass,
    data=full_dataset,
    train_ratio=0.7,  # 70% train, 30% test
    n_splits=5,       # 5 windows
    initial_capital=10000.0
)

# Aggregate results
for i, result in enumerate(results):
    print(f"Split {i+1}: Profit=${result.total_profit:.2f}, "
          f"Sharpe={result.sharpe_ratio:.2f}")

docs.title: Monte Carlo Simulation
docs.text:
# Assess risk distribution
mc_results = backtester.monte_carlo_simulation(
    trades=result.trades,
    n_simulations=1000,
    initial_capital=10000.0
)

print(f"Mean Final Capital: ${mc_results['final_capital_mean']:.2f}")
print(f"5th Percentile: ${mc_results['percentile_5']:.2f}")
print(f"95th Percentile: ${mc_results['percentile_95']:.2f}")
print(f"Worst Drawdown: {mc_results['max_dd_worst']*100:.2f}%")

docs.title: Parameter Optimization
docs.text:
from yunmin.core.backtester import OptimizationMethod

# Define parameters to optimize
param_grid = {
    'fast_period': [9, 12, 15],
    'slow_period': [21, 26, 30],
    'rsi_threshold': [30, 35, 40]
}

# Optimize
opt_result = backtester.optimize_parameters(
    strategy_class=MyStrategyClass,
    data=historical_data,
    param_grid=param_grid,
    optimization_metric='sharpe_ratio',
    method=OptimizationMethod.GRID_SEARCH
)

print(f"Best Parameters: {opt_result.best_params}")
print(f"Best Sharpe: {opt_result.best_score:.2f}")

docs.title: HTML Report
docs.text:
# Generate professional report
report_path = backtester.generate_html_report(
    result=backtest_result,
    strategy_name="My AI Strategy",
    output_path="reports/backtest_report.html"
)

print(f"Report saved to: {report_path}")

Expected Results: - Professional-grade performance metrics - Robust validation preventing overfitting - Optimal parameter discovery - Clear performance visualization

docs.title: Integration Example
docs.text:
Here's how to use all components together:

from yunmin.strategy.ai_ensemble import AIEnsembleStrategy
from yunmin.strategy.position_optimizer import PositionOptimizer
from yunmin.ml.regime_detector import RegimeDetector

class IntegratedStrategy:
    def __init__(self):
        self.ai = AIEnsembleStrategy(
            groq_api_key="...",
            openrouter_api_key="...",
            openai_api_key="..."
        )
        self.optimizer = PositionOptimizer(initial_capital=10000)
        self.detector = RegimeDetector()

    def analyze(self, df):
        # 1. Detect regime
        regime = self.detector.detect_regime(df)

        # 2. Get AI signal
        signal = self.ai.analyze(df)

        # 3. Check regime requirements
        adjustments = self.detector.get_strategy_adjustments(regime.regime)

        if signal.confidence < adjustments['required_confidence']:
            return None  # Signal too weak for current regime

        # 4. Calculate position size
        position = self.optimizer.calculate_position_size(df, signal.confidence)

        # 5. Apply regime multiplier
        final_size = position.adjusted_size * regime.position_sizing_recommendation

        return {
            'signal': signal.type,
            'position_size': final_size,
            'regime': regime.regime,
            'confidence': signal.confidence
        }

docs.title: API Keys Setup
docs.text:
Set environment variables for AI providers:

export GROQ_API_KEY="your_groq_api_key"
export OPENROUTER_API_KEY="your_openrouter_api_key"
export OPENAI_API_KEY="your_openai_api_key"

Or provide them directly in code:

strategy = AIEnsembleStrategy(
    groq_api_key="sk-...",
    openrouter_api_key="sk-...",
    openai_api_key="sk-..."
)

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Start with Paper Trading: Test thoroughly before live trading
  2. Use Walk-Forward Validation: Always validate out-of-sample
  3. Monitor Disagreements: Review AI ensemble disagreements for insights
  4. Respect Regime Changes: Don't force trades in wrong regimes
  5. Track Performance: Use position optimizer statistics
  6. Regular Re-optimization: Markets change, parameters should adapt
  7. Risk Management: Never risk more than you can afford to lose

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
1. Set up API keys for all three AI providers
  2. Backtest on historical data using AdvancedBacktester
  3. Optimize parameters using grid search
  4. Validate with walk-forward testing
  5. Run Monte Carlo simulations to understand risk
  6. Deploy to paper trading for real-time validation
  7. Gradually transition to live trading with proper risk limits

docs.title: Alert Rules (Phase 3 - Live Trading)
docs.text:
Purpose: Define alert triggers, severity levels, and automated responses for live trading monitoring.

Alert Levels: INFO (informational) | WARN (monitor, may require adjustment) | CRIT (immediate action required)

docs.title: Daily Drawdown Exceeded
docs.text:
Rule ID: CRIT_DAILY_DD

Parameter Value Metric Daily Drawdown Threshold > 2.0% Check Interval Every 1s (real-time) Auto-Action KILL_SWITCH → Close all positions Manual Override No (forced)

Logic: 

if (current_balance - peak_daily_balance) / peak_daily_balance > 0.02:
    trigger_kill_switch()
    close_all_positions()
    log_critical("Daily DD exceeded 2% - kill switch triggered")

Notification: 

🔴 CRITICAL: Daily Drawdown Exceeded
Current DD: 2.3%
Peak Balance: $300.00
Current Balance: $293.10
Action: KILL_SWITCH - Closing all positions

docs.title: WebSocket Stale (No Updates)
docs.text:
Rule ID: CRIT_WS_STALE

Parameter Value Metric Time since last WS update Threshold > 60 seconds Check Interval Every 5s Auto-Action Force reconnect, then KILL_SWITCH if fails Manual Override No (forced)

Logic: 

time_since_last_ws_update = time.time() - last_ws_message_time
if time_since_last_ws_update > 60:
    log_critical(f"WS stale for {time_since_last_ws_update}s - reconnecting")
    await ws_layer.reconnect()
    if not await ws_layer.is_connected():
        trigger_kill_switch()
        log_critical("WS reconnection failed - kill switch triggered")

Notification: 

🔴 CRITICAL: WebSocket Stale
Last Update: 2025-01-26 12:15:30 UTC (75s ago)
Action: Force reconnect
Fallback: Kill-switch if reconnect fails

docs.title: REST API Error Rate High
docs.text:
Rule ID: CRIT_REST_ERRORS

Parameter Value Metric REST errors in 1-min window Threshold ≥ 2 consecutive errors Check Interval Every 10s Auto-Action Pause orders, escalate Manual Override May retry after 60s

Logic: 

rest_errors_last_minute = [e for e in error_log if time.time() - e['timestamp'] < 60]
if len(rest_errors_last_minute) >= 2:
    log_critical(f"REST errors: {len(rest_errors_last_minute)} in 1 min")
    executor.pause_orders()
    send_alert(level="CRIT", message=f"REST API errors: {errors}")
    # Can retry after manual inspection

Notification: 

🔴 CRITICAL: REST API Errors
Count (1m): 2 errors
Errors:
  - 14:25:10: 429 Too Many Requests
  - 14:25:22: 503 Service Unavailable
Action: Order placement PAUSED - await engineer review

docs.title: Stuck Order (Unfilled > 5 minutes)
docs.text:
Rule ID: CRIT_STUCK_ORDER

Parameter Value Metric Time in "NEW" state (unfilled) Threshold > 5 minutes Check Interval Every 30s Auto-Action Cancel order + log Manual Override No (automatic cancel)

Logic: 

for order_id, order in open_orders.items():
    time_open = time.time() - order['created_time']
    if time_open > 300:  # 5 minutes
        log_critical(f"Stuck order {order_id} for {time_open}s - canceling")
        await cancel_order(order_id)
        send_alert(level="CRIT", message=f"Stuck order canceled: {order_id}")

Notification: 

🔴 CRITICAL: Stuck Order
Order ID: 2147483648
Symbol: BTCUSDT
Type: LIMIT
Created: 2025-01-26 14:20:00 UTC (7m 42s ago)
Status: NEW (unfilled)
Action: Order CANCELED - manual investigation required

docs.title: Hard Drawdown Limit (Emergency Stop)
docs.text:
Rule ID: CRIT_HARD_DD

Parameter Value Metric Daily Drawdown Threshold > 5.0% (hard limit) Check Interval Every 1s Auto-Action EMERGENCY_STOP → Close all + disable trading Manual Override No

Logic: 

if daily_dd > 0.05:
    log_critical("EMERGENCY: Hard DD limit (5%) exceeded - disabling trading")
    await close_all_positions(market_order=True)
    executor.disable_trading()
    trigger_emergency_alert("HARD_DD_LIMIT_EXCEEDED")

Notification: 

🔴 EMERGENCY: Hard Drawdown Limit Exceeded
Current DD: 5.8%
Limit: 5.0%
Action: EMERGENCY_STOP
  - All positions closed at market
  - Trading DISABLED
  - Engineer notification sent
  - Post-mortem review required

docs.title: High Latency
docs.text:
Rule ID: WARN_HIGH_LATENCY

Parameter Value Metric REST/WS latency p95 Threshold > 1,500 ms Check Interval Every 60s Auto-Action Log + report Manual Override Monitor, may adjust strategy

Logic: 

latency_p95 = percentile(latency_samples, 0.95)
if latency_p95 > 1500:
    log_warning(f"High latency: {latency_p95}ms")
    send_alert(level="WARN", message=f"REST latency p95: {latency_p95}ms - above target")

Notification: 

🟡 WARNING: High Latency
REST p95: 1,850 ms (target: ≤ 1,500 ms)
WS p95: 125 ms (nominal)
Assessment: REST API slower than normal
Action: Monitor next 10 minutes; consider reducing order frequency

docs.title: WebSocket Reconnects High
docs.text:
Rule ID: WARN_WS_RECONNECTS

Parameter Value Metric WS reconnect count Threshold > 4 per day Check Interval Daily (06:00 UTC) Auto-Action Log + report Manual Override Investigate network

Logic: 

daily_reconnects = sum(1 for r in reconnect_log if is_today(r['timestamp']))
if daily_reconnects > 4:
    log_warning(f"WS reconnects today: {daily_reconnects}")
    send_alert(level="WARN", message=f"WS reconnected {daily_reconnects}x today - network may be unstable")

Notification: 

🟡 WARNING: WebSocket Reconnects High
Count (24h): 5 reconnects
Log:
  - 06:15: Connection timeout (recovered in 3s)
  - 08:42: Unexpected disconnect (recovered in 2s)
  - 10:30: Network latency spike (recovered in 5s)
  - 14:20: Binance API restart (recovered in 1s)
  - 16:55: Connection reset (recovered in 4s)
Action: Check ISP/network stability; consider VPN

docs.title: Order Rejection Rate High
docs.text:
Rule ID: WARN_REJECT_RATE

Parameter Value Metric Rejected orders / total orders Threshold > 2% in 1-hour window Check Interval Every 10 min Auto-Action Log + investigate Manual Override Adjust order params

Logic: 

hour_window = [o for o in order_log if time.time() - o['timestamp'] < 3600]
rejects = sum(1 for o in hour_window if o['status'] == 'REJECTED')
total = len(hour_window)
reject_rate = rejects / total if total > 0 else 0

if reject_rate > 0.02:
    log_warning(f"Reject rate: {reject_rate*100:.1f}% (threshold: 2%)")
    send_alert(level="WARN", message=f"Order rejection rate: {reject_rate*100:.1f}%")

Notification: 

🟡 WARNING: Order Rejection Rate High
Rate (1h): 3.2% (target: ≤ 2%)
Details:
  - Total orders: 125
  - Rejected: 4
  - Common reason: Insufficient balance (2), Invalid price (1), Duplicate (1)
Action: Review risk parameters; ensure balance adequate

docs.title: Fill Rate Low
docs.text:
Rule ID: WARN_FILL_RATE

Parameter Value Metric Market fills / total market orders Threshold < 85% Check Interval Every 6 hours Auto-Action Log + report Manual Override Adjust order sizing

Logic: 

market_orders = [o for o in order_log if o['type'] == 'MARKET' and time.time() - o['timestamp'] < 3600*6]
fills = sum(1 for o in market_orders if o['status'] == 'FILLED')
fill_rate = fills / len(market_orders) if market_orders else 1.0

if fill_rate < 0.85:
    log_warning(f"Fill rate: {fill_rate*100:.1f}%")
    send_alert(level="WARN", message=f"Market fill rate: {fill_rate*100:.1f}% (target: ≥ 85%)")

Notification: 

🟡 WARNING: Market Fill Rate Low
Rate (6h): 78% (target: ≥ 85%)
Details:
  - Market orders: 23
  - Filled: 18
  - Partial: 3
  - Unfilled: 2
Action: Check bid-ask spreads; may indicate low liquidity

docs.title: Daily Trade Count High
docs.text:
Rule ID: WARN_HIGH_TRADE_COUNT

Parameter Value Metric Trades per day Threshold > 50% of daily limit Check Interval Every 4 hours Auto-Action Log + report Manual Override Monitor strategy

Logic: 

daily_trade_count = sum(1 for t in trade_log if is_today(t['timestamp']))
daily_limit = risk_manager.max_daily_trades
utilization = daily_trade_count / daily_limit

if utilization > 0.50:
    log_warning(f"Daily trades: {daily_trade_count}/{daily_limit} ({utilization*100:.0f}% utilized)")
    send_alert(level="WARN", message=f"Daily trade count: {daily_trade_count} (limit: {daily_limit})")

Notification: 

🟡 WARNING: High Daily Trade Count
Count: 12 / 20 (60% of limit)
Remaining today: 8 trades
Assessment: Good pace; monitor for overactivity
Action: None (nominal); continue trading if signals present

docs.title: Commission/Fee Impact High
docs.text:
Rule ID: WARN_HIGH_FEES

Parameter Value Metric Total fees / total P&L Threshold > 25% Check Interval Daily Auto-Action Log + report Manual Override Optimize order params

Logic: 

total_fees = sum(f['amount'] for f in fee_log if is_today(f['timestamp']))
total_pnl = calculate_daily_pnl()
fee_impact = total_fees / total_pnl if total_pnl > 0 else 0

if fee_impact > 0.25:
    log_warning(f"Fee impact: {fee_impact*100:.1f}% of P&L")
    send_alert(level="WARN", message=f"Fees are {fee_impact*100:.0f}% of P&L")

Notification: 

🟡 WARNING: High Fee Impact
Daily fees: $2.50
Daily P&L: +$8.00
Impact: 31.25% of profit
Assessment: Trading too frequently relative to returns
Action: Consider reducing trade frequency or using limit orders

docs.title: Order Executed Successfully
docs.text:

Parameter Value Trigger Order status = FILLED Check Interval Real-time Action Log + optional notification

docs.title: Daily Summary
