Happy Strategy Building! 📊

docs.title: Step 1: Visit Binance Testnet
docs.text: Navigate to: https://testnet.binance.vision/

docs.title: Step 2: Register/Login
docs.text:
• Click "Register" if new user
  • Or "Login" if you have an account
  • Use any email (no verification needed for testnet)

docs.title: Step 3: Generate API Keys
docs.text:
1. After login, click on your email in top-right
  2. Select "API Management"
  3. Click "Create API"
  4. Give it a name (e.g., "YunMin_V3_Test")
  5. Complete 2FA if enabled
  6. IMPORTANT: Copy both:
  7. API Key
  8. Secret Key (Secret key is shown only once!)

docs.title: Step 4: Enable Spot Trading
docs.text:
1. Go to "API Management"
  2. Find your newly created API key
  3. Click "Edit Restrictions"
  4. Enable "Enable Spot & Margin Trading"
  5. Save changes

docs.title: Step 5: Get Testnet Funds
docs.text:
1. Go to your account page
  2. Find "Testnet Faucet" or similar option
  3. Request testnet USDT (usually instant)
  4. You'll get fake USDT for testing (~1000-10000 USDT)

docs.title: Option 1: Copy from Example
docs.text:
cp .env.testnet.example .env.testnet

Then edit .env.testnet and replace placeholders with your actual keys.

docs.title: Option 2: Create Manually
docs.text:
Create file .env.testnet in project root:

# Binance Testnet Credentials
BINANCE_TESTNET_API_KEY=your_actual_api_key_here
BINANCE_TESTNET_API_SECRET=your_actual_secret_key_here

# Risk Management
MAX_POSITION_SIZE_PCT=10.0
MAX_LEVERAGE=1.0
MAX_DAILY_DRAWDOWN_PCT=5.0

# Trading Settings
SYMBOL=BTCUSDT
INITIAL_CAPITAL=10000
COMMISSION_RATE=0.001

# Monitoring
LOG_LEVEL=INFO

⚠️ SECURITY WARNING: - NEVER commit .env.testnet to git - File is already in .gitignore - Keep API secrets confidential even for testnet

docs.title: ✅ Verify Setup
docs.text:
Run the readiness check:

python check_testnet_ready.py

Expected output: 

✅ BINANCE_TESTNET_API_KEY: abcd****wxyz
✅ BINANCE_TESTNET_API_SECRET: 1234****7890
✅ Ping successful
✅ Server time sync OK
✅ Sufficient testnet funds: $10000.00
🎉 ALL CHECKS PASSED - V3 READY FOR TESTNET DEPLOYMENT!

docs.title: Dry Run (Recommended First)
docs.text:
python run_testnet.py --dry-run --duration 0.1
This runs for 6 minutes without placing real orders. Good for testing.

docs.title: Full 48-Hour Run
docs.text: python run_testnet.py --duration 48

docs.title: Indefinite Run (Manual Stop)
docs.text:
python run_testnet.py
Press Ctrl+C to stop gracefully.

docs.title: 📊 Monitoring During Run
docs.text:
Bot logs will show: - ⏱ Runtime - 📊 Trade count (Wins/Losses) - 📈 Win Rate - 💰 P&L and Return % - 💵 Current Capital - 📉 Max Drawdown - 🔁 Consecutive Losses

Emergency shutdown triggers: - 🚨 Drawdown > 10% - 🚨 5+ consecutive losses

docs.title: 🔍 After Run
docs.text:
Trade log saved to: testnet_trades_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.json

Contains: - Session start/end times - Initial/final capital - All trades with timestamps, prices, P&L - Final statistics

docs.title: "API key not found" Error
docs.text:
• Double-check API key is correct
  • Make sure key is for TESTNET (not mainnet)
  • Verify key has "Spot Trading" enabled

docs.title: "Signature verification failed"
docs.text:
• Check API secret is correct
  • Ensure system time is synced
  • Try regenerating API keys

docs.title: "Insufficient balance"
docs.text:
• Request more testnet funds from faucet
  • Lower INITIAL_CAPITAL in .env.testnet

docs.title: "Connection timeout"
docs.text:
• Check internet connection
  • Binance testnet may be down (rare)
  • Try again in a few minutes

docs.title: 📚 Next Steps
docs.text:
After successful 48h testnet run: 1. Review testnet_trades_*.json log 2. Calculate actual Win Rate, P&L, Drawdown 3. Compare with V3 backtest results 4. Decide: Deploy to mainnet OR optimize strategy 5. If optimizing, V4 improvements can be tested on testnet data

Good luck! 🚀

docs.title: YunMin V3: 48-Hour Testnet Validation Plan
docs.text: Version: 1.0 Date: 2025-11-04 Status: Ready for Execution

docs.title: 🎯 Objectives
docs.text:
Validate YunMin V3 strategy performance on Binance Testnet with real market data before mainnet deployment.

Success Criteria: 1. System stability (no crashes for 48h) 2. Win Rate ≥ 50% 3. Positive net P&L 4. Max Drawdown < 10% 5. Risk manager functioning correctly 6. No emergency shutdowns

docs.title: Pre-Launch (T-1h)
docs.text:
• [ ] Complete testnet setup (API keys, funds)
  • [ ] Run check_testnet_ready.py - all checks PASS
  • [ ] Run dry-run for 10 minutes
  • [ ] Verify logs are being saved correctly

docs.title: Launch (T=0)
docs.text: python run_testnet.py --duration 48 --symbol BTCUSDT --capital 10000

docs.title: Monitoring Schedule
docs.text: Time Action Checklist T+1h Initial Check ✅ Bot running✅ Trades being placed✅ Risk manager approving/rejecting T+6h Review #1 ✅ Log file readable✅ Stats update correctly✅ No errors in logs T+12h Mid-Day 1 Review 📊 Calculate interim metrics📈 Check win rate trend💰 Review P&L T+24h Day 1 Complete 📄 Generate Day 1 report🔍 Analyze trade distribution⚖️ LONG vs SHORT balance T+36h Mid-Day 2 Review 📊 Compare Day 1 vs Day 2🔁 Check for degradation⚠️ Monitor drawdown T+48h Final Review 🛑 Graceful shutdown📊 Full analysis✅ Go/No-Go decision

docs.title: Real-Time (Every Check)
docs.text:
• Runtime: Hours since start
  • Total Trades: Count
  • Win Rate: % winning trades
  • P&L: Net profit/loss in USD and %
  • Current Capital: Real-time balance
  • Max Drawdown: Peak-to-trough decline
  • Consecutive Losses: Streak counter

docs.title: Aggregated (12h/24h Reviews)
docs.text:
• Hourly Trade Rate: Trades per hour
  • Average Win: Mean profit per winning trade
  • Average Loss: Mean loss per losing trade
  • Profit Factor: Gross profit / Gross loss
  • Sharpe Ratio: Risk-adjusted return
  • LONG Performance: Win rate, P&L
  • SHORT Performance: Win rate, P&L
  • Risk Manager Stats: Approved vs Rejected orders

docs.title: 🚨 Emergency Stop Conditions
docs.text:
Bot will auto-shutdown if:

  1. Max Drawdown > 10%
  2. Trigger: Capital drops 10% from peak

  3. Action: Cancel all orders, log emergency, exit

  4. 5 Consecutive Losses

  5. Trigger: 5 trades in a row lose money

  6. Action: Cancel all orders, log warning, exit

  7. System Errors

  8. Trigger: API errors, connectivity loss

  9. Action: Retry 3 times, then graceful shutdown

  10. Manual Override

  11. Trigger: User sends SIGINT (Ctrl+C) or SIGTERM
  12. Action: Cancel all orders, save logs, exit

docs.title: ✅ Tier 1: PASS (Ready for Mainnet)
docs.text:
• [ ] Win Rate ≥ 60%
  • [ ] Total Return ≥ +5%
  • [ ] Profit Factor ≥ 2.0
  • [ ] Max Drawdown ≤ 5%
  • [ ] No emergency stops
  • [ ] LONG WR ≥ 50%
  • [ ] SHORT WR ≥ 50%

docs.title: ⚠️ Tier 2: CONDITIONAL PASS (Needs Optimization)
docs.text:
• [ ] Win Rate ≥ 50%
  • [ ] Total Return ≥ 0% (breakeven)
  • [ ] Profit Factor ≥ 1.5
  • [ ] Max Drawdown ≤ 10%
  • [ ] ≤ 1 emergency stop
  • [ ] Either LONG or SHORT performing well

docs.title: ❌ Tier 3: FAIL (Back to Drawing Board)
docs.text:
• Win Rate < 50%
  • OR Total Return < 0%
  • OR Profit Factor < 1.0
  • OR Max Drawdown > 10%
  • OR Multiple emergency stops
  • OR Both LONG and SHORT underperforming

docs.title: Automatic Logs
docs.text:
• Trade Log: testnet_trades_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.json
  • Every trade: timestamp, symbol, side, price, quantity, P&L
  • Session metadata: start/end time, initial/final capital

  • Aggregated stats

  • Console Log: stdout/stderr

  • Real-time bot status
  • Risk manager decisions
  • API call logs
  • Error messages

docs.title: Manual Recordings (Optional)
docs.text:
• Screenshots of Binance testnet account balance
  • Market conditions during test (trending/ranging/volatile)
  • Notable events (large moves, connection issues)

docs.title: Step 1: Load Trade Data
docs.text:
import json

with open('testnet_trades_20251104_120000.json') as f:
    data = json.load(f)

trades = data['trades']
stats = data['stats']

docs.title: Step 2: Calculate Metrics
docs.text:
# Win Rate
win_rate = stats['win_rate']

# P&L
total_pnl = stats['total_pnl']
return_pct = stats['return_pct']

# Drawdown
max_dd = stats['max_drawdown']

# LONG vs SHORT
long_trades = [t for t in trades if t['side'] == 'BUY']
short_trades = [t for t in trades if t['side'] == 'SELL']

long_wr = sum(1 for t in long_trades if t['pnl'] > 0) / len(long_trades) * 100
short_wr = sum(1 for t in short_trades if t['pnl'] > 0) / len(short_trades) * 100

docs.title: Step 3: Generate Report
docs.text:
Create markdown report with: - Summary stats - V3 Backtest vs Testnet comparison - LONG/SHORT analysis - Risk manager effectiveness - Recommendations

Template: TESTNET_48H_REPORT_TEMPLATE.md

docs.title: ✅ Go/No-Go Decision Matrix
docs.text:
Metric Target Weight Pass Threshold Win Rate ≥60% High ≥50% Total Return ≥+5% High ≥0% Max Drawdown ≤5% Critical ≤10% Profit Factor ≥2.0 Medium ≥1.0 Emergency Stops 0 Critical ≤1 LONG WR ≥50% Medium ≥40% SHORT WR ≥50% Medium ≥40%

Weighted Score Formula: 

Score = (0.25 × WR_pass) + (0.25 × Return_pass) + 
        (0.20 × DD_pass) + (0.15 × PF_pass) + 
        (0.10 × EmergencyStop_pass) + (0.05 × LONG_pass + SHORT_pass)

  • Score ≥ 0.85: ✅ GO for Mainnet
  • Score 0.60-0.84: ⚠️ CONDITIONAL - Optimize first
  • Score < 0.60: ❌ NO GO - Major rework needed

docs.title: Issue: Bot Stops After Few Minutes
docs.text:
Symptoms: Early exit, minimal trades Causes: - Emergency stop triggered (check logs) - API authentication failure - Insufficient testnet funds

Fix: 1. Check testnet_trades_*.json for error messages 2. Verify API keys are correct 3. Request more testnet USDT 4. Lower --capital parameter

docs.title: Issue: No Trades Generated
docs.text:
Symptoms: Bot runs but 0 trades Causes: - Strategy not generating signals - Risk manager rejecting all orders - Market too stable (no crossovers)

Fix: 1. Check strategy logs for signal generation 2. Review risk manager rejection reasons 3. Wait for more volatile market conditions 4. Consider lowering RSI thresholds temporarily

docs.title: Issue: High Loss Rate
docs.text:
Symptoms: Win rate < 30%, negative P&L Causes: - Market conditions unfavorable (strong trend against signals) - Stop losses too tight - Take profits too far

Fix: 1. Analyze market trend during test period 2. Review backtest assumptions vs reality 3. Consider V4 optimizations (asymmetric SL/TP) 4. Test on different market conditions

docs.title: Issue: Connection Errors
docs.text:
Symptoms: API timeouts, WebSocket drops Causes: - Binance testnet downtime - Network issues - Rate limiting

Fix: 1. Check Binance testnet status page 2. Increase request timeout in connector 3. Add retry logic with exponential backoff 4. Use VPN if geographic restrictions

docs.title: Technical Review
docs.text:
• [ ] All trades logged correctly
  • [ ] No data corruption in JSON
  • [ ] Risk manager approved/rejected as expected
  • [ ] No unhandled exceptions in logs
  • [ ] Graceful shutdown executed
  • [ ] Balance reconciliation: expected vs actual

docs.title: Performance Review
docs.text:
• [ ] Win rate calculated
  • [ ] P&L matches testnet account
  • [ ] Drawdown peak identified
  • [ ] Trade distribution analyzed (hourly, daily)
  • [ ] LONG vs SHORT balance acceptable
  • [ ] Comparison with V3 backtest documented

docs.title: Risk Review
docs.text:
• [ ] No emergency stops triggered (or justified if triggered)
  • [ ] Max position sizes respected
  • [ ] No excessive losses on single trades
  • [ ] Drawdown stayed within limits
  • [ ] Risk manager logs reviewed for patterns

docs.title: Business Review
docs.text:
• [ ] Strategy viability confirmed or questioned
  • [ ] Optimization opportunities identified
  • [ ] Mainnet deployment plan updated
  • [ ] Budget estimate for real capital
  • [ ] Timeline for next phase approved

docs.title: If Tier 1 PASS:
docs.text:
1. Prepare Mainnet Deployment
  2. Get real Binance API keys (mainnet)
  3. Start with small capital ($100-500)
  4. Run for 1 week before scaling up

  5. Monitor daily with same rigor

  6. Documentation

  7. Archive testnet results
  8. Create mainnet runbook
  9. Update risk limits for real money

docs.title: If Tier 2 CONDITIONAL:
docs.text:
1. Implement V4 Optimizations
  2. Add asymmetric SL/TP
  3. Test trend filters on testnet data

  4. Run another 48h testnet cycle

  5. Fine-Tune Parameters

  6. Adjust RSI thresholds
  7. Modify EMA periods
  8. Backtest with new params first

docs.title: If Tier 3 FAIL:
docs.text:
1. Root Cause Analysis
  2. Deep dive into losing trades
  3. Identify systematic issues

  4. Challenge strategy assumptions

  5. Strategy Redesign

  6. Consider simpler approaches
  7. Test alternative indicators
  8. Validate on historical data before testnet

docs.title: 📞 Support & Escalation
docs.text:
During 48h Test: - Monitor logs in real-time - Set alerts for emergency stops - Have team available for quick fixes

Critical Issues: - API authentication failures → Regenerate keys immediately - Consistent losses → Consider early termination - System crashes → Investigate logs, fix, restart

Post-Test: - Schedule review meeting within 24h - Document lessons learned - Update this plan for future tests

Ready to Launch! 🚀

Last updated: 2025-11-04 Next review: After 48h testnet run
